From toufeeqh at gmail.com  Thu Sep 28 10:16:41 2006
From: toufeeqh at gmail.com (Toufeeq Hussain)
Date: Thu Sep 28 10:16:54 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] ReiserFS for linux
In-Reply-To: <aec5a5f80609270940w5acae8daq5aa823df3a47d3b8@mail.gmail.com>
References: <aec5a5f80609270940w5acae8daq5aa823df3a47d3b8@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <c293dd340609272146t6131d051mad8102c8a56d67ee@mail.gmail.com>

Hi,

On 9/27/06, Balachandran Sivakumar <contactsbala@gmail.com> wrote:
> Hello all,
>
>          I see more people talking about ReiserFS for GNU/Linux. What
> are the advantages of using ReiserFs instead of the ext3. Also does
> ReiserFS get detected by other OS like the open solaris etc.

Reiser4 is the fastest filesystem in terms of I/O performance.
Source : http://bulk.fefe.de/lk2006/talk.pdf (pages 27,28)

Fefe is well regarded in the benchmarking circles so you can take the
above link as a good, valid source.

On why Reiser4 is not in mainline this page answers all questions.
http://kernelnewbies.org/WhyReiser4IsNotIn

HTH,
Toufeeq
-- 
blog @ http://toufeeq.net
From manokaran at gmail.com  Thu Sep 28 11:07:40 2006

	<9a9bfc170609270615h58a36221t1696f9885506ab8b@mail.gmail.com>

Message-ID: <7bf1bec50609272237t58caa26awde32f967602f6820@mail.gmail.com>

On 9/27/06, Prashanth Mohan <prashmohan@gmail.com> wrote:
>
> R.Ramkumar wrote:
> > using reiserfs (now reiser4) and I am content. It's more a issue of
>
> Just out of curiosity, do you find reiser4 stable? Reiser4 is not into
> the main kernel line yet.
>

If I remember right, reiserfs is not included in the main kernel because of
disputes regarding coding style - the relevant maintainer wanting the coding
style to conform to the strict kernel standards but Reiser maintaining that
his style is better than the kernel standards! Not really an issue with the
stability of reiserfs.

regds,
mano

From rajasuperman at gmail.com  Thu Sep 28 11:51:50 2006
From: rajasuperman at gmail.com (Raja Subramanian)
Date: Thu Sep 28 11:51:59 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] ReiserFS for linux
In-Reply-To: <c293dd340609272146t6131d051mad8102c8a56d67ee@mail.gmail.com>
References: <aec5a5f80609270940w5acae8daq5aa823df3a47d3b8@mail.gmail.com>
	<c293dd340609272146t6131d051mad8102c8a56d67ee@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <92f9a9560609272321ydc03631rdc20972e31cb0fad@mail.gmail.com>

On 9/28/06, Toufeeq Hussain <toufeeqh@gmail.com> wrote:
> Reiser4 is the fastest filesystem in terms of I/O performance.
> Source : http://bulk.fefe.de/lk2006/talk.pdf (pages 27,28)

<ZFS bigot mode>

IMO, ZFS has far outclassed every other file system in
existence today.  ZFS excels in features, data protection,
scalability, and manageability.

Note that ZFS checksums every byte of data on disk, and
verifies it on every disk read/write.  Inspite of this
overhead, it still blows BSD UFS out of the water in the
above benchmarks and is second best only to reiser4.
Impressive.

Given sufficient interest, at the next lug meet, I can run
through the ZFS design, features, comparison with existing
filesystems, and a hands on demo.

</ZFS bigot mode>

- Raja

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Thu Sep 28 00:30:52 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Thu Sep 28 13:01:23 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Doubts in Kernel Compilation.
In-Reply-To: <451B518B.3000507@midascomm.com>
Message-ID: <20060928073052.78818.qmail@web50209.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi Sivaram,

--- Sivaram Kannan <sivaramsk@midascomm.com> wrote:
> Do I have to do anything for the image to specify
> the type of machine or 
> it will get detected automatically?

When you compile the kernel, you have to choose the
processor and system type that you have.

In both 2.4 and 2.6 Linux kernels, it will be under
"Processor type and features" when you do make
menuconfig.

> Actually for booting from 
> Debian i am passing
> a parameter vga=771 to the kernel. I have tried
> giving this parameter 
> also for the compiled one.

The vga=771 will work if the video driver supports
this resolution as per your X configuration file -
/etc/X11/xorg.conf or /etc/X11/XF86Config depending on
whether you are using Xorg or XFree86, respectively.

Regards,

SK

--
Shakthi Kannan
http://www.shakthimaan.com

References: <451B518B.3000507@midascomm.com>
	<20060928073052.78818.qmail@web50209.mail.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <c293dd340609280041y6689fc3r7952fb157f2557fd@mail.gmail.com>

Hi,

On 9/28/06, Shakthi Kannan <cyborg4k@yahoo.com> wrote:
> > Actually for booting from
> > Debian i am passing
> > a parameter vga=771 to the kernel. I have tried
> > giving this parameter
> > also for the compiled one.
>
> The vga=771 will work if the video driver supports
> this resolution as per your X configuration file -
> /etc/X11/xorg.conf or /etc/X11/XF86Config depending on
> whether you are using Xorg or XFree86, respectively.

the 'vga' parameter passed to the kernel during boot-time is the
console-mode which is used by the framebuffer device (if one exists)
and is not connected to CPU arch or Xfree86/Xorg.

-Toufeeq

blog @ http://toufeeq.net
From toufeeqh at gmail.com  Thu Sep 28 13:15:58 2006
From: toufeeqh at gmail.com (Toufeeq Hussain)
Date: Thu Sep 28 13:16:06 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Adding memory
In-Reply-To: <f789e6550609280037h517c06pcfc48d04f5e0df32@mail.gmail.com>
References: <f789e6550609280037h517c06pcfc48d04f5e0df32@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <c293dd340609280045o2e2239eav978812f12651cd81@mail.gmail.com>

Hi,

On 9/28/06, padma priya <pipri123@gmail.com> wrote:
> Hi All
> I want to know how to add/mount additional memory in the hard disk without
> losing out any of the files existing on a RedHat System.
> Thanks in advance,
> Padma Priya

I'm guessing you mean resizing existing partions when you mean "adding
memory to hard-disk". Here is a link.

http://www.redhat.com/docs/manuals/linux/RHL-9-Manual/custom-guide/s1-parted-resize-part.html

If you have a single root partition you have to unmount the partition
before resizing it. Consider using Knoppix for resizing it in that
case. If you are not resizing the root partition consider gParted
which is the GUI front end for parted.

HTH,
-Toufeeq

-- 
blog @ http://toufeeq.net
From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Thu Sep 28 00:55:09 2006

> boot-time is the
> console-mode which is used by the framebuffer device
> (if one exists)

From rajanvn at gmail.com  Thu Sep 28 13:33:11 2006
From: rajanvn at gmail.com (Natarajan V)
Date: Thu Sep 28 13:33:22 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Adding memory
In-Reply-To: <f789e6550609280037h517c06pcfc48d04f5e0df32@mail.gmail.com>
References: <f789e6550609280037h517c06pcfc48d04f5e0df32@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <e977d4310609280103r93d9a4cu1c01ae62a620d183@mail.gmail.com>

On 9/28/06, padma priya <pipri123@gmail.com> wrote:
> Hi All
> I want to know how to add/mount additional memory in the hard disk without
> losing out any of the files existing on a RedHat System.


Hi Priya,

The summary of our "off the list" discussion is as follows. There are
some open questions... which I leave to the community to kindly
complete :-)


1. First attatch the new hard disk to your new server.
1a. How to verify the hdd is detected? -- Please complete

2. Use any partition/hard disk manager (partd/fdisk/gpartd ... any
other -- please fill) to format the hard disk and mount the same onto
some location

3. put your new files on this new folder.

4. if you want to move existing directories to the new hard disk, move
them using "mv" and put a symbolic link to the old location.
Hint: moving the /var folder to the new hdd would give a lot of space
:-) if you are using the server for huge compilations.

Regards,
Natarajan.

> I have Debian 3.1 installed. I compiled the version >2.16.17.10.
>It compilied without any problems,
> but when i gave make bzImage the image got created in arch/i386.

 days back i compiled this kernel and installed that, things went
fine. I dont think u need to make ur bzImage, once u compile every
thing will be done auto, even grub entries(this happen with me)..

make xconfig

make

make modules

make modules_install

make install

since the compilation went fine i think that should work.

Message-ID: <154eca020609280901t35f8c831ud4feb12f17792933@mail.gmail.com>

One of my friends is facing a problem with their network, whose
description follows. He is not subscribed to the list - I have
CCed him. Good if someone can help him out ...

<problem>

I am getting the following messages on the console continusouly...
kernel: eth1: Too much work in interrupt, status e401.
We are experiencing packet loss that are going through this system.

Google'ing indicates that this is one of the rarest problems and
doesn't seem to address the exact error. One indicated to increase
/proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_conntrack_max value... changed it from 32760
(defalut) to 65520 (doubled it as it was not accepting any other
values). Still no help.

There is a file /proc/net/ip_conntrack, the file size is 0 bytes but
when I cat that file shows about 15000 entries like

tcp      6 19 SYN_SENT src=192.168.1.66 dst=9.121.32.211 sport=2382
dport=445 [UNREPLIED] src=9.121.32.211 dst=220.227.67.130 sport=445
dport=2382 use=1

Looks like iptables cache... I suspect clearing this would help..
but I dont' how to.

Hardware: duel PIV, 512MB, RAID5
Services: iptables firewall,  postfix
Network configuration: two NICs - eth0:public ip provided by ISP,
eth1: LAN IP.

</problem>

Date: Fri Sep 29 12:28:10 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] {Commercial] Job openings at Terminus - Embedded Systems
Message-ID: <C142C1BA.1EB%sundar@terminus.in>

Hi All,

Here at Terminus, we develop high end consumer electronic devices including
Hi-Definition DVD players and set-top boxes. To assist our development team
in chennai we welcome passionate and enterprising engineers with the
following skill sets.

* Exceptional C/C++ Programming skills
* Knowledge of AV codecs and decoders is a definite plus
* Strong knowledge of linux and device driver programming
* Code optimization and profiling skills
* Strong knowledge of CPU and System Architecture
* Knowledge of ARM/MIPS architecture is desirable
* Working knowledge of SCM and GNU toolchain

If you think you meet the above requirements and have more than one year of
working experience or you have worked on challenging projects in the areas
of AV codecs please send your resume to sundar@terminus.in

Freshers with a strong project backing may also apply if you think you fit
the bill.

Thanks,
Sundar B Iyer
Director - Technology & Marketing
Terminus Graphics Studios Pvt Ltd.,
Chennai.

Subject: [Ilugc] Partitioning the harddisk
Message-ID: <20060929115827.49610.qmail@web8715.mail.in.yahoo.com>

Hi all,
   
  I want to install Fedora 5, Debian 3.1 and XP on my 80 GB HDD.
   
  I installed XP on my machine.Then installed Fedora 5 with root and swap partitions.No probes in this.
  As of now Fedora and XP works fine.
   
  Then installed Debian 3.1 with new root partition and with the same swap used by fedora.Debian is listing all the three in the grub. 
  Now debian and XP works fine. 
   
  But if I choose Fedora it stops at SELINUX loading stage.
  Should I have to disable the SELINUX before installing the Debian?
   
  On the otherahand if i install in the order Xp,debian and Fedora then fedora replies back with error message it cannot have two root partitions.
   
  Can I have common swap for debain and fedora linux ?
  Is there any specific order to install this?

From nagappan at gmail.com  Fri Sep 29 18:52:48 2006
From: nagappan at gmail.com (Nagappan A)
Date: Fri Sep 29 18:52:57 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] LDTP 0.6.0 released !!!
Message-ID: <9d0602eb0609290622n7b70f74er8a2b29fad82ece1b@mail.gmail.com>

Issue IX - 28 September 2006

We are proud to announce the release of LDTP 0.6.0. This release
features number of important breakthroughs in LDTP as well as in the
field of Test Automation. This release note covers a brief introduction
on LDTP followed by the list of new features and major bug fixes which
makes this new version of LDTP the best of the breed. Useful references
have been included at the end of this article for those who wish to hack
/ use LDTP.

About LDTP
==========

Linux Desktop Testing Project is aimed at producing high quality test
automation framework and cutting-edge tools that can be used to test
Linux Desktop and improve it. It uses the Accessibility libraries to
poke through the application's user interface. The framework also has
tools to record test-cases based on user events in the interface of the
application which is under testing. We strive to help in building a
quality desktop.

This release features an all new TCP interface of the server which, is
covered briefly below.

Recording has taken new heights and the code is much organized now. More
bug fixing and documentation changes.

Whats new in this release...
============================
+ Remote TCP based execution
    Tests can, now, be carried out from a remote terminal.  LDTP Clients
can connect to the new TCP interface and run tests with-in the box that
is running the server.  This kind of interface comes handy for testing
applications running in small devices.  This interface is contributed by
"Palm Source".

+ Recording using LDTP
    This new version of LDTP features a recorder tool which would help in
generating automation scripts automatically by recording user events.
This would greatly reduce the time required for creating and maintaining
automation scripts. Thanks to Venkateswaran ('whacko'), Harishankaran
('sp2hari') and Theyagarajan ('Taggy') for making this happen. For more
information on this please refer to
http://ldtp.freedesktop.org/wiki/RecordHOWTO

+ Bug fixes
    This version includes loads of bug fixes to address important issues
like memory leak, API functionality, accessibility compatible issues
etc., For a detailed list please refer to release notes section of our
project site hosted in http://ldtp.freedesktop.org. Thanks to all the
developers for their contribution and dobey especially.

LDTP news
=========

 * Accessibility test suite by Rodney Dawes (dobey) -
http://webcvs.freedesktop.org/ldtp/a11y-test-suite/
 * LDTP presentation in GNOME Accessibility summit, Boston, 2006
 * LDTP Presentation in Mozilla Accessibility summit, Boston, 2006

LDTP Recording demo
=============

Record / Playback of scripts -
http://freeshell.in/%7Etaggy/ldtp/ldtpguidemo.html

References
=======

For detailed information on LDTP framework and latest updates visit
http://ldtp.freedesktop.org

For information on various APIs in LDTP including those added for this
release can be got from http://ldtp.freedesktop.org/user-doc/index.html

To subscribe to LDTP mailing lists, visit
http://ldtp.freedesktop.org/wiki/Mailing_20list

IRC Channel - #ldtp on irc.freenode.net

For suggestions to improve this newsletter, please write to
jpremkumar@novell.com


-- 
Linux Desktop Testing Project - http://ldtp.freedesktop.org
http://nagappanal.blogspot.com

Debian/Ubuntu repositories have this utility ``lshw''. See if it helps.

$ sudo lshw
$ sudo lshw-gtk

Subject: [Ilugc] [OT] Shaastra Lecture

Pre-Shaastra Lecture:
====================
Topic  : "Enabling India - The TeNeT Experience"
Time   : Sun Oct 1st 20:00 2006
Venue  : Main Hall, IC&SR, IIT-Madras.
Speaker: Padma Shri Dr. Ashok Jhunjhunwala.

Dr. Ashok Jhunjhunwala, is a Professor at the Dept of Electrical
Engineering, IIT-Madras. He received his B.Tech(1975) from IIT-K
and MS & PhD from the Univ of Maine, USA. He is the founder of
the TeNeT Group and he is on the boards of large corporations like
BSNL, HTL, RBI, Polaris, Sasken, etc.. [http://www.tenet.res.in/]

Bye :)
-- 
Bharathi S

From cyborg4k at yahoo.com  Sat Sep 30 20:21:46 2006
From: cyborg4k at yahoo.com (Shakthi Kannan)
Date: Sun Oct  1 08:52:07 2006
Subject: [Ilugc] Monthly reminder: Mailing list guidelines
Message-ID: <20061001032146.46645.qmail@web50206.mail.yahoo.com>

Hi,

Please don't reply to this e-mail. If you would like
to update it, do it here:

  http://chennailug.org/guidelines

1. Use a proper subject line.

2. Do not troll in the mailing list

Link: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_troll

3. Use [OT] for off-topic, non-technical discussions.
But, don't misuse this to start flame wars or to troll
in the mailing list.

4. Do not top-post:

Link: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Top-posting

Example of a top-post:

Because it messes up the order in which
people normally read text.
> > Why is top-posting
> > such a bad thing?
Top-posting.
> > What is the most
> > annoying thing in e-mail?

Always use bottom-posting.

> What is your name ?
My name is ILUGC.

5. Do not over-quote:

Example of an over-quote:

>>> On Friday you said
>>> blah blah blah
>> On Saturday you said
>> foo foo foo
> On Sunday you said
> foobar

6. Do not post HTML messages

7. Do not recycle messages

8. Do not send attachments

9. Do not attach obnoxious, nonsensical legal
disclaimers. If your company uses disclaimers, don't
use your company ID for the mailing list.

10. Do not reply to a digest. (If you are in digest
mode and want to reply to a post use ILUGC Gmane blog
interface.

Link:
http://blog.gmane.org/gmane.org.user-groups.linux.ilugc

11. Search for answers for your questions/problems in
google.com or any other search engine before posting
your query to the mailing list.

If any of the above are not clear to you, Please read
the detailed list guidelines:

Link:
http://www.catb.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html

12. Do not post messages in all capital letters. Mails
in CAPS is considered rude and is similar to shouting
during a conversation.

13. If you or your company is into GNU/Linux
migration, or you want help into GNU/Linux migration,
check here:
http://www.chennailug.org/wiki/GNU_Linux_migration

14. If you are looking for GNU/Linux distro CDs please
check here:
http://www.chennailug.org/wiki/CDs_for_Grab

15. Following these guidelines could be helpful
http://people.debian.org/~enrico/dcg/

16. Don't send season's greetings or birthday invites
to the group. Its not mailing list etiquette.

We must use the above guidelines to maintain better
readability, proper archives, efficient bandwidth
usage, etc. 

__________________________________________________
Do You Yahoo!?
Tired of spam?  Yahoo! Mail has the best spam protection around 
http://mail.yahoo.com
